solution_line_template: The puppy will consume {first_period_days}*{food_per_day_first_period} = <<{first_period_days}*{food_per_day_first_period}={food_consumed_first_period}>>{food_consumed_first_period} ounces of the special dog food in the first {first_period_days} days.

This leaves {days_in_year} - {first_period_days} = {remaining_days} days where the puppy will consume {food_per_day_second_period} ounces of food per day, or {remaining_days}*{food_per_day_second_period} = {food_consumed_second_period} ounces of the special food.

Thus, the puppy requires a total of {food_consumed_first_period} + {food_consumed_second_period} = <<{food_consumed_first_period}+{food_consumed_second_period}={total_food_ounces}>>{total_food_ounces} ounces of food before it is 1 year old.
Each {bag_size_pounds}-pound bag contains {bag_size_pounds}*{ounces_per_pound} = <<{bag_size_pounds}*{ounces_per_pound}={ounces_per_bag}>>{ounces_per_bag} ounces of special dog food.
Therefore, the puppy will need to eat {total_food_ounces}/{ounces_per_bag} = {exact_bags_needed} bags of the special dog food, meaning the family will need to buy 17 bags.
